page.title: 03Stocks Farm Ditchling 1985
page.content: I have been connected with farming since l959.My husband who was born in the original farmhouse has been farming all his life.His father bought the farm in l921 and cows have been milked here since;today the farm is the only one producing milk in the village.The cows are loose_housed in a covered yard in winter and are milked in a cowstall through a pipeline system into a bulk tank.The milk is collected daily.We grow barley and oats to feed the cows and young stock.Wheat is grown for the chicken which are in a deep litter house.Bought_in day old pullets are reared as free range until they begin to lay eggs.The eggs are sold privately through various outlets. Orphan lambs are reared on the bottle then fattened for our own use.
